title: Start-ups set out to make coffee more sustainable - Financial Times
summary: Companies around the world are exploring ways to reduce waste and promote sustainability in the coffee industry. Woodpecker, a Bogotá-based construction firm, makes building materials from coffee husks. Kaffeeform turns spent coffee grounds into reusable cups. The Green Coffee Company has developed a circular economy model that generates bigger profits by turning coffee pulp into a range of products, including fertilizer and ethanol.
green_innovation: TRUE, because the innovations described in the article contribute to environmental sustainability goals, such as reducing waste and conserving natural resources.
business_innovation: TRUE, because the innovations described in the article are new or improved products or business processes that differ significantly from the company's previous products or business processes.
green_product: TRUE, because the products described in the article are designed, manufactured, and used in a way that significantly reduces their environmental impact throughout their life cycle.
green_process: TRUE, because the processes described in the article are methods or techniques in manufacturing, production, or any other operational activity that minimize environmental impacts and promote sustainability.
product_or_process: Building boards made from coffee husks

title: ESGL Holdings Limited (NASDAQ: ESGL) Announces Multi-Year Contract Renewal with Singapore Refining Company ... - GlobeNewswire
summary: Environmental Solutions Group Holdings Limited (ESGL) has renewed a multi-year contract with Singapore Refining Company Private Limited (SRC) to provide used catalyst waste disposal services through December 31, 2025. ESGL is a leading carbon neutral, innovative enviro-tech company regenerating industrial waste into circular products. The company's strategy, execution, and long-term potential are supported by long-term partners like SRC.
green_innovation: TRUE, ESGL's waste management solutions and circular economy approach contribute to environmental sustainability goals by reducing waste and promoting resource conservation.
business_innovation: TRUE, ESGL's used catalyst waste disposal services represent a new or improved business process that differs significantly from previous processes and has been brought into use in the firm.
green_product: FALSE, the article does not describe a specific green product.
green_process: TRUE, ESGL's used catalyst waste disposal services minimize environmental impacts and promote sustainability by reducing waste and conserving resources.

title: Reboxed® secures £1.6 million Seed investment led by ACF Investors - UK Tech Investment News
summary: Reboxed®, a sustainable tech startup, has secured £1.6 million in funding to help solve the e-waste crisis by rehoming 100 million electronic devices by 2030. Reboxed® provides out-of-the-box solutions for retailers and businesses to accelerate the move to a circular economy. The company will use the funds to drive growth and further develop its retail partner programs and Reboxed for business service.
green_innovation: TRUE. Reboxed®'s recommerce platform and services help businesses and consumers reduce e-waste and transition to a circular economy.
business_innovation: TRUE. Reboxed®'s recommerce platform and services are new and innovative ways to buy and sell technology, and they have the potential to significantly change the way that businesses and consumers think about and use technology.
green_product: TRUE. Reboxed®'s premium refurbished and pre-owned devices are designed to extend the life of electronic devices and reduce e-waste.
green_process: TRUE. Reboxed®'s recommerce platform and services are designed to reduce e-waste and promote a circular economy.
product_or_process: Recommerce platform and services for electronic devices
